      • scale

        public Scale scale()
        Description copied from interface: Image
        Returns the pixel-scale of this image. This will be Scale.ONE unless HiDPI images are being used.
        Specified by:
        scale in interface Image

      • ensureTexture

        public int ensureTexture()
        Description copied from interface: Image
        Creates a texture for this image (if one does not already exist) and returns its OpenGL texture id. Returns 0 if the underlying image data is not yet ready or if this platform does not use OpenGL. The texture will remain in GPU memory until Image.clearTexture() is called or this image is garbage collected.

        Note: this texture handle should not be held for longer than the scope of the enclosing function call. It is not safe to hang onto an image's texture handle as the image may delete its texture and recreate it under any number of circumstances.

        Specified by:
        ensureTexture in interface Image

      • clearTexture

        public void clearTexture()
        Description copied from interface: Image
        Clears the GPU texture associated with this image, on platforms implemented via OpenGL. Does nothing on non-OpenGL platforms. In general it is not necessary to call this method. Images added to ImageLayer instances automatically clear their texture when the image layer is removed from the scene graph. Textures are also cleared when the image is garbage collected. However, if you manually call Image.ensureTexture(), or if you draw images to a Surface, you may wish to clear textures manually to avoid running out of GPU memory before garbage collection has a chance to run and clear the textures for you.
        Specified by:
        clearTexture in interface Image

      • reference

        public void reference()
        Description copied from class: AbstractImageGL
        Increments this image's reference count. Called by ImageLayerGL to let the image know that it's part of the scene graph. Note that this reference counting mechanism only exists to make more efficient use of texture memory. Images are also used by things like Pattern which does not support reference counting, thus images must also provide some fallback mechanism for releasing their texture when no longer needed (like in their finalizer).
        Overrides:
        reference in class AbstractImageGL<GC>

      • release

        public void release()
        Description copied from class: AbstractImageGL
        Decrements this image's reference count. Called by ImageLayerGL to let the image know that may no longer be part of the scene graph.
        Overrides:
        release in class AbstractImageGL<GC>

      • setBounds

        public void setBounds(float x,
             float y,
             float width,
             float height)
        Description copied from interface: Image.Region
        Updates this region's bounds in its parent image. If you need a rapidly changing region of an image, this can be more efficient than repeatedly creating new subimages as it creates no garbage to be collected.
        Specified by:
        setBounds in interface Image.Region

      • addCallback

        public void addCallback(Callback<? super Image> callback)
        Description copied from interface: Image
        Adds a callback to be notified when this image has loaded. If the image is already loaded, the callback will be notified immediately; otherwise on the main playn thread at a later time. The callback is discarded once the image is loaded.
        Specified by:
        addCallback in interface Image

      • subImage

        public Image.Region subImage(float x,
                    float y,
                    float width,
                    float height)
        Description copied from interface: Image

        Specified by:

        width - the width (in pixels) of the subimage.

      • toPattern

        public Pattern toPattern()
        Description copied from interface: Image
        Creates a Pattern that can be used to use this image as a fill in a canvas. This pattern will repeat based on the image's repeat configuration.
        Specified by:
        toPattern in interface Image
        Overrides:
        toPattern in class AbstractImageGL<GC>

      • getRgb

        public void getRgb(int startX,
          int startY,
          int width,
          int height,
          int[] rgbArray,
          int offset,
          int scanSize)
        Description copied from interface: Image
        Extracts pixel data from a rectangular area of this image. This method may perform poorly, in particular on HTML and Flash platforms - avoid using this if possible. The returned pixel format is (alpha << 24 | red << 16 | green << 8 | blue), where alpha, red, green and blue are the corresponding channel values, ranging from 0 to 255 inclusive.
        Specified by:
        getRgb in interface Image
        Overrides:
        getRgb in class AbstractImageGL<GC>
        Parameters:
        startX - x-coordinate of the upper left corner of the area.
        startY - y-coordinate of the upper left corner of the area.
        width - width of the area.
        height - height of the area.
        rgbArray - will be filled with the pixel data from the area
        offset - fill start offset in rgbArray.
        scanSize - number of pixels in a row in rgbArray.

      • transform

        public Image transform(Image.BitmapTransformer xform)
        Description copied from interface: Image
        Generates a new image from this image's bitmap, using a bitmap transformer created for the platform in use. See JavaBitmapTransformer and IOSBitmapTransformer. This does not work on sub-images nor SurfaceImages.
        Specified by:
        transform in interface Image
        Overrides:
        transform in class AbstractImageGL<GC>
